intro: Boesenbergia parvula var. parvula, commonly known as the small-leaf ginger, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and turmeric. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in spikes. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The botanical structure of this plant is characterized by its rhizomatous growth and aromatic, lanceolate foliage.
